page.title: 17Colchester Computers.
page.content: The market for computer sales rose to a very high level in 1983, but now it has levelled out and the future seems more uncertain. One of Colchester's oldest firms selling electronic equipment has a section in Gosbecks road selling computers. They are agents for the Apricot company whose model F1 has 768k RAM, a disc drive and monitor, and an infra - red keyboard. Ken Cheeseman started his company in 1952, and the new computer section deals mainly with business machines. Colchester Computer Centre, and other shops in the town cater for the home micro computer enthusiast.
